data.title: Siteground hosting - how do you compare?
data.meta_description: Want to know how you compare withh Siteground?I run a load of sites on there (eg www.propress.com.au ) and they have always giâ¦
data.text:
Hi Matthew,

To add to what has already been mentioned by KFSys.

Itâs great to hear about your good experience with Siteground, especially with their quick support.

DigitalOcean is very user-friendly, especially if you want to set up things quickly. They have something called 1-click Droplets available on the Marketplace. This means you can start a website, a blog, or other online services with just a click. It saves a lot of time with the initial server configuration.

About customer support: The support system here is a bit different but equally efficient in its own way. DigitalOcean has a strong emphasis on community support, with an extensive library of tutorials, Q&A, and a vibrant community forum. This rich resource of information allows users to find answers quickly and learn in the process.

For direct support, DigitalOcean offers different levels, including ticket-based support for all users and premium support plans for businesses requiring more immediate assistance. The support team is knowledgeable, especially about complex, technical issues, which can be a huge asset if youâre managing sophisticated projects or infrastructure.

Also, if you like DigitalOcean but want something a bit more like Siteground, you can use Cloudways. Cloudways is a service that works with DigitalOcean to make things even easier to manage, like handling a website or an online store.

In short, DigitalOcean is great if you like to have more control and learn new things as you will have root access to your servers.

Happy hosting!

Bobby
